etymology.interpretation: Combines the illness radical 疒 indicating disease with 沙 as the sound component shā. This structure signals a sickness-related term, later applied to heat rash/summer-heat illness and cholera in traditional medical usage.

examples.chinese: 他得了暑痧(他得了暑痧)，需要中医调理(需要中醫調理)。
examples.pinyin: Tā déle shǔshā, xūyào zhōngyī tiáolǐ.
examples.english: He has summer-heat illness and needs traditional Chinese medical treatment.

examples.chinese: 在旧籍中(在舊籍中)，霍乱被称为痧症(霍亂被稱為痧症)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jiùjí zhōng, huòluàn bèi chēngwéi shāzhèng.
examples.english: In old texts, cholera was called the shā-illness.

examples.chinese: 他胸闷腹泻(他胸悶腹瀉)，被诊断为暑痧(被診斷為暑痧)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiōngmèn fùxiè, bèi zhěnduàn wéi shǔshā.
examples.english: He had chest oppression and diarrhea and was diagnosed with summer-heat illness.
